General.title: Web Development
General.description: Test your knowledge of web development history, core concepts, and fundamental technologies that power the modern web.

questions.question: Who is credited with inventing the World Wide Web?
In which year was the World Wide Web first introduced?
What was the first web browser called?
Which company created the first popular graphical web browser?
What does 'WWW' stand for?
What is the main purpose of HTML in web development?
What was CSS created to handle?
Which language was introduced to add interactivity to web pages?
When was JavaScript first created?
Who created JavaScript?
What does the term 'frontend' refer to in web development?

answers.text: The client-facing part of a website

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a frontend technology?
What does the term 'backend' refer to?

answers.text: The part of a website users interact with

questions.question: Which protocol is used to transfer web pages over the Internet?
What is the secure version of HTTP called?
Which of the following is a popular backend language?
Which of these introduced the concept of responsive design?
What is the main purpose of a web server?

answers.text: To store and serve website content

questions.question: What was the first version of HTML officially released?
Which organization maintains web standards today?

HTML.title: HTML
HTML.description: Master the fundamentals of HTML, the markup language that structures all web content and forms the backbone of every website.

questions.question: What does HTML stand for?
Which tag is used to create a hyperlink?
Which attribute specifies the URL of a link?
Which tag is used to display an image?
What attribute provides alternative text for an image (important for accessibility)?
Which element defines the main heading of a page?
Which tag is used to group table rows?
Which attribute makes a form input required before submission?
Which doctype declaration is correct for HTML5?
Which element is used to include JavaScript in an HTML page?
Which HTML attribute is used to define inline styles?
Which tag is semantic and intended to contain navigation links?
Which element is used for the document metadata (like character set and title)?
Which input type is used to accept an email address with built-in validation?
Which tag creates an ordered (numbered) list?
Which attribute on the <a> tag opens the link in a new browser tab?
What is the purpose of the <meta name="viewport"> tag?

answers.text: To link a stylesheet for printing
To control layout on mobile browsers and responsive behavior

questions.question: Which HTML5 element is used to draw graphics via scripting (e.g., JavaScript)?
Which element represents a self-contained composition in a document, such as a blog post or article?
Which character entity is used to represent a non-breaking space in HTML?

CSS.title: CSS
CSS.description: Explore styling and design with CSS, learn how to create beautiful, responsive layouts and bring your web pages to life.

questions.question: What does CSS stand for?
Which HTML tag is used to define an internal style sheet?
Which property is used to change the background color?
Which property controls the text size?
How do you select an element with id 'header'?
Which CSS property is used to change text color?
How do you make each word in a text start with a capital letter?
Which property is used to change the font of an element?
Which property is used to control the spacing between lines of text?
Which property makes an element invisible but still occupies space?
Which property is used to add shadow to text?
Which value of position places the element relative to the browser window?
How do you make text bold in CSS?
What does the z-index property control?
Which property controls the space between elements' borders?
Which property is used to create rounded corners?
Which property allows text to wrap inside a container?
Which property defines the transparency of an element?
What is the default position value of HTML elements?
Which CSS property sets the space between the border and the content?

JavaScript.title: JavaScript
JavaScript.description: Challenge yourself with JavaScript questions covering syntax, data types, functions, and modern ES6+ features that power interactive web applications.

questions.question: What is JavaScript primarily used for in web development?
Which HTML tag is used to include JavaScript code?
How do you write 'Hello World' in an alert box?
Which symbol is used for comments in JavaScript?

answers.text: // for single-line and /* */ for multi-line comments

questions.question: Which keyword declares a block-scoped variable?
Which operator is used to assign a value to a variable?
What is the correct syntax to log a message to the console?
Which data type is NOT primitive in JavaScript?
Which method converts JSON data into a JavaScript object?
What will `typeof null` return in JavaScript?
Which method adds an element to the end of an array?
How do you write an arrow function in JavaScript?
Which statement stops the execution of a loop?
What is the result of 3 + '3' in JavaScript?
Which keyword is used to define a constant in JavaScript?
What will `Boolean(0)` return?
Which symbol is used for strict equality comparison?
Which method removes the last element from an array?
What will `console.log(typeof NaN)` print?
Which built-in method returns the length of a string?

React.title: React
React.description: Test your knowledge of React - the popular JavaScript library for building dynamic user interfaces and single-page applications.

questions.question: What is React primarily used for?
Who developed React?
What is JSX in React?
Which method is used to create a functional component in React?
What hook is used to handle state in functional components?
What does the useEffect hook do?
Which of these is true about React components?

answers.text: They can be reused across different parts of an app

questions.question: What is the purpose of props in React?

answers.text: To pass data from parent to child components

questions.question: What is the virtual DOM in React?

answers.text: A lightweight copy of the real DOM used for efficient updates
A browser API for rendering HTML

questions.question: What is the default port for React development server?
What does lifting state up mean in React?

answers.text: Moving shared state to a common ancestor component
Passing props down from parent to child

questions.question: What is React Router used for?
Which hook is used to access context in React?
What is the purpose of keys in React lists?

answers.text: To help React identify which items have changed

questions.question: What does useRef return?

answers.text: A mutable ref object with a .current property

questions.question: What is React.StrictMode used for?

answers.text: To highlight potential problems in an app

questions.question: Which function is used to create context in React?
What command is used to create a new React app using Create React App?
What is the purpose of useMemo hook?
Which library is often used with React for state management?

Node.js.title: Node.js
Node.js.description: Dive into server-side JavaScript with Node.js - learn about modules, asynchronous programming, and building scalable backend applications.

questions.question: What is Node.js primarily used for?
Which of the following is true about Node.js?

answers.text: It uses the V8 JavaScript engine

questions.question: Which command is used to initialize a new Node.js project?
What file is used to define dependencies in a Node.js project?
Which module is built-in for handling file operations?
How do you import a built-in module in Node.js?
Which of the following frameworks is built on top of Node.js?
What does the 'npm' command stand for?
How do you start a Node.js application?
Which of the following is NOT a core module in Node.js?
Which event is emitted when a stream ends in Node.js?
What is the default scope of variables in Node.js modules?
Which method is used to read a file asynchronously?
Which object is used to handle events in Node.js?
What is the purpose of the 'require' function?
Which keyword is used to export a module in Node.js?
What does 'process' represent in Node.js?
Which method stops the Node.js process?
Which of these can handle HTTP requests in Node.js?
What does 'callback' refer to in Node.js?

answers.text: A function executed after another finishes

Rust.title: Rust
Rust.description: Explore Rust programming - a systems language focused on safety, speed, and concurrency without garbage collection.

questions.question: What is Rust primarily known for?

answers.text: Memory safety without a garbage collector

questions.question: Who developed Rust?
What is Cargo in Rust?

answers.text: Rust's build system and package manager

questions.question: What command creates a new Rust project?
Which file defines Rust project metadata and dependencies?
What keyword is used to define a variable in Rust?
What does 'mut' mean when used with a variable?
What does the 'ownership' concept ensure in Rust?

answers.text: Memory is managed safely without garbage collection
Multiple variables can own the same data
Rust uses reference counting by default

questions.question: What happens when a variable goes out of scope in Rust?

answers.text: It is sent to the garbage collector

questions.question: Which keyword is used to define a function in Rust?
What symbol is used to indicate a reference in Rust?
What is a 'trait' in Rust?

answers.text: A collection of methods that can be implemented by types

questions.question: What keyword is used to define a constant in Rust?
What is the output type of the 'main' function in most Rust programs?
Which keyword is used to import modules or traits in Rust?
What is pattern matching in Rust primarily done with?
Which of the following is NOT a valid data type in Rust?
Which macro is commonly used to print output in Rust?
What is a 'crate' in Rust?
What does 'unwrap()' do when used on a Result type?

answers.text: Returns the value if Ok, panics if Err
